comments:
Running on gentoo linux:

When using either the all in one bundle or after installing pdt via the update site, the eclipse gui hangs using the following steps:
1) start eclipse
2) create a new php project
3) close eclipse
4) start eclipse... gui hangs after the workbench is rendered.

Note:
- running on gentoo linux (eclipse _not_ installed via emerge/portage):
- removed existing workspace prior to taking the above steps.
- the exceptions in the log below re-occur every 5 seconds while eclipse is left running.

Here is the log:

org.eclipse.php_feature-S20070611_M1 is the latest integration build that does not have this issue. This was probably introduced sometime between M1 and M2.

Little more info which may or may not useful.  First off, like Paulius, I can reproduce the issue on windows (windows 2000).  Also, unlike I previously thought, eclipse will not hang indefinitely.  After 2 or 3 minutes on either os, these errors will be exhausted and eclipse will begin to behave normally.

Yep, I'm getting a similar issue.  Logs are attached.

This was also reported in bug 209408, which actually addresses a different issue, but this issue is seen there as well.

Created an attachment (id=84320)
Shows Timeouts during initialization.

The timeouts cause anywhere from a 30 second to 2 minute delay in eclipse becoming useable.  This does not add to the user experience.
bug 205243 seems to be a duplicate of this bug.

traces.message: State change in progress for bundle "update@plugins/org.eclipse.php.core_1.0.0.v20070917.jar" by thread "Worker-1".
